data.fullContent: When management and employees don't work together, the whole company suffers. Employees who feel like their concerns aren't being heard are going to lose respect for the company and may be more likely to come to work late, skip work, or do a poor job. Companies who ignore their employees' needs don't have a lot of success. While they may be making money, they are losing out on potential growth. The more the company values its workers and their opinions, the more motivated employees are likely to be. If a company doesn't have good workers, they won't have a good company.
